thread.title: Thousands attend funeral of Leeds teenager Irfan Wahid
thread.title_full: Thousands attend funeral of Leeds teenager Irfan Wahid | Calendar - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Thousands attend funeral of Leeds teenager Irfan Wahid
text:
Play video Video report by David Hirst The family of a teenager who was stabbed to death in Leeds last week has issued a call for forgiveness and calm.
Irfan Wahid, 16, died after an incident in Harehills last Friday.
Today, thousands gathered at his funeral at Harehills Central Mosque, where his father Wahid Hussain told mourners that he is prepared to forgive his attacker.
After the service, friends held a vigil at the spot on Harehills Lane where Irfan was attacked.
A 16-year-old boy, who cannot be named for legal reasons, appeared at Leeds Crown Court earlier, charged with Irfan's murder and possession of a 'bladed article'. He was remanded in custody until 23 March.
 Leeds West Yorkshire
